source: Public records, court documents, and verified news sources

entities.name: Donald Trump
entities.occupation: President, businessman, former real estate developer
entities.summary: Documented social relationship with Epstein in 1990s-early 2000s, primarily through Mar-a-Lago and NYC social circuits. Trump claimed relationship ended around 2004.
entities.significance: Current US President with documented historical connection to Epstein

entities.name: Jeffrey Epstein
entities.occupation: Former financier and convicted sex offender
entities.summary: Central figure in sex trafficking case. Died in federal custody August 2019.

entities.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
entities.summary: Convicted December 2021 on federal charges related to sex trafficking. Currently serving 20-year sentence.
entities.significance: Key figure convicted in case, extensive documentary evidence

entities.name: Virginia Roberts Giuffre
entities.summary: Primary victim-witness in multiple cases. Provided extensive testimony and depositions.

entities.name: Bill Clinton
entities.occupation: Former President of the United States
entities.summary: Documented on Epstein's flight logs multiple times. Clinton stated trips were for Clinton Foundation work.
entities.significance: Former president with documented travel on Epstein's aircraft

entities.name: Prince Andrew
entities.occupation: Duke of York (title suspended), former Royal Navy officer
entities.summary: Accused by Virginia Giuffre, settled civil case in 2022. Stripped of military titles and royal patronages.
entities.significance: British royal with allegations and civil settlement

entities.name: Alan Dershowitz
entities.summary: Represented Epstein in 2008 plea deal. Accused by Virginia Giuffre (allegations denied, defamation settlements reached).

entities.name: Les Wexner
entities.occupation: Former CEO of L Brands (Victoria's Secret, Bath & Body Works)
entities.summary: Epstein's primary financial client and close associate. Gave Epstein power of attorney. Cut ties in 2007.
entities.significance: Epstein's primary patron and financial client

entities.name: Jean-Luc Brunel
entities.summary: Modeling agent accused of procuring girls for Epstein. Found dead in French prison in 2022 while awaiting trial.
entities.significance: Associate accused of trafficking, died before trial

entities.name: Sarah Kellen
entities.summary: Epstein's former assistant, named in court documents. Granted immunity in 2008 deal.
entities.significance: Key associate mentioned in victim testimony

entities.name: Lesley Groff
entities.summary: Long-time Epstein employee mentioned in court documents.

entities.name: Stephen Miller
entities.role_2026: Deputy Chief of Staff for Policy
entities.summary: Trump administration official, no known connection to Epstein case.
entities.significance: Current government official for cross-reference purposes

entities.name: Elon Musk
entities.summary: Attended dinner at Epstein's NYC residence in 2011 (reported). No allegations of involvement in illegal activities.
entities.significance: Current Trump advisor with minimal documented Epstein contact

entities.name: Bill Gates
entities.summary: Met with Epstein multiple times after 2011, including overnight stays at Epstein's NYC residence. Gates stated meetings were about philanthropy.
entities.significance: Prominent figure with post-conviction contact with Epstein

entities.name: Marvin Minsky
entities.summary: MIT professor accused in court documents. Died in 2016. MIT stated allegations were unfounded.

entities.name: Glenn Dubin
entities.summary: Hedge fund manager and Epstein associate. Employed Sarah Kellen after she left Epstein.

entities.name: Eva Andersson-Dubin
entities.summary: Dated Epstein in 1980s-90s, later married Glenn Dubin. Remained friends with Epstein.
entities.significance: Former girlfriend who maintained social ties
